Text:
This story is set before the Blood Queen's
resurrection.
Is this a new kimono from Mitsugoshi?
Yes. It's a sample, to be precise.

Please feel free to pick it up and take a closer
look.
Hmm...

This...texture feels incredible. What is this
material?

It should be the same material we use at Snow Fox
Corporation...

But the quality is clearly a grade or two higher...
Perhaps a difference in processing methods?

Texture aside, I think the design and coloring are
also splendid.

Indeed... The pattern appears simple at a glance,
but the color choices are impressive.

This one has the pattern of a captivating flower,
I've never seen one like this before.

It may be an imaginary flower, but this background...
gives the impression that it actually exists.

The designer Mitsugoshi employs is certainly highly
skilled.

Until now, Snow Fox Corporation held an almost
exclusive monopoly on kimono in the Lawless City...

Recently, many people have expressed a desire to wear
a Mitsugoshi kimono.

Hmm... It could be interesting to try changing Snow
Fox Corporation's policy.
Let's try replicating and selling this kimono.
Well, umm, you mean...
As in steal their design?

"Steal" is a strong word. I'd prefer to say we're
"referencing" it.

Mitsugoshi's products are undeniably excellent. Over
time, such products become the benchmark others aim
for.

As a result of such aims, it's not uncommon for
finished products to "coincidentally" end up
looking similar...
"C-Coincidentally." Right...

Besides, women of the red-light district want kimono
with these kinds of patterns and designs.

There's a demand, so we supply it. That's only
natural for a business.
I...suppose you're right...
I understand the resistance to copying products.

However, improvements in quality often begin with
competition and comparison.

Many things have come about from referring to the
wisdom of those who've come before us. From arts
such as painting, singing, and dancing to everyday
cuisine...
I see. True...

Don't worry so much. It's not like we can make an
exact replica.

Every piece naturally has its own distinct quirks,
and that's what gives it its unique character.

So you're saying the differences that emerge when we
copy Mitsugoshi's products are what will define our
uniqueness.

As I said, "copying" is a bad word.
We're "referencing."

M-My apologies. I will "refer" to this Mitsugoshi
kimono!

Good, good. Study it thoroughly until you know it
inside and out, and be sure to meticulously
"reference" it.

In that case, we will put all our effort into
"referencing" it.

After all, I managed to adapt my senior's dance and
harp playing to my own style in just a month.

Heheh. Kana, Natsume, your eyes seem to have really
lit up.
(I wonder if I was ever like this... No, maybe not.)
(I had no choice, living in this Lawless City...)

(I had to hold on desperately, clinging to dear
life...and now I've clawed my way up to the top.)
Heheh.
Lady Yukime...?

Oh, it's nothing. You two are just a little too
dazzling.
Us two?

Yes, that's right. It's not a bad thing at all.
Dazzle to your heart's content.

(Everyone doesn't have to think like me...and that
is a very good thing.)

(Life in the red-light district was tough, but it
wasn't all bad...)

(Kana and Natsu remind me of that. They're both my
subordinates and my friends.)

Alright... Natsu, let's split the sample and each
take half of it back for research.

Got it. Let's thoroughly analyze why Mitsugoshi's
kimono are so fantastic!
Heheh. That's the spirit, you two.

(That said, Mitsugoshi... It only just started up,
yet it's already making great strides.)

(They're expanding their business in various
directions, even encroaching into my territory...
Heheh. Things are getting interesting.)
